text.p: Dresdner Bank AG, Germany's second largest commercial bank, said on Friday that institutional asset management was one of the most profitable and promising business areas in international banking.
Chairman Juergen Sarrazin told the bank's annual shareholder meeting that he expected the pace of growth in this segment to continue and even accelerate in some areas.
"The pension funds segment is of particular significance. The urgently needed restructuring of the old age provision system, especially in Europe, leaves one to expect above average growth," he said.
Sarrazin said the integration of its international asset management units was almost complete.
Dresdner has 330 billion marks in assets under management in Europe, including private and institutional assets.
